clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Electroencephalogram - Guided Anesthetic Care on Delirium After Laparoscopic Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Electroencephalogram - Guided Anesthetic Care on Delirium After Laparoscopic Surgery: a Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The study is a prospective, double blinded, randomized and controlled parallel trial to investigate the impact of the anesthetic care guided by EEG monitor (SedLine).

detailed_description.textblock: To investigate the impact of the anesthetic care guided by EEG monitor (SedLine) on (1) the incidence of delirium in post-anesthesia care unit (PACU) and within the first five days after laparoscopic surgery and (2) the incidence of in-hospital complications and 30-day mortality in adult patients after laparoscopic surgery.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: The study is a prospective, double blinded, randomized 1:1 and controlled parallel trial.
study_design_info.masking_description: This is a double blinded, randomized and controlled parallel trial

primary_outcome.description: Delirium is an acute brain dysfunction characterized by inattention, disorganized thinking, and a fluctuating course

secondary_outcome.description: Complications after surgery such as acute kidney injury, cardiac events, cerebrovascular events, renal injury, GI complications, infections etc.
Speed of GI function recovery (pass gas)
length of time in ICU admission
length of time in ICU stay

other_outcome.description: Numeric Rating Scale subjective pain where 0 indicates no pain and 10 indicates the worst pain.
Numeric Rating Scale subjective sleep quality at 8:00 am where 0 indicates best possible sleep and 10 indicates worst possible sleep

arm_group.description: All recruited patients from the intervention group will receive SedLine EEG Brain Function Monitoring.
Participants randomized to the control arm will receive no placebo intervention- receiving only standard of care procedures.

overall_official.affiliation: Yale School of Medicine Department of Anesthesiology
